title: How to Train a Houseplant to Climb a Wall! (It's so simple it's unbelievable!)

tasks.task: Train plants to climb a wall using command hooks
subtasks: Gather materials (command hooks)
Choose a suitable plant for wall training (e.g., jade pothos, air plants)
Identify a location on the wall for attaching the command hook
Attach a command hook to the wall using the sticky side
Gently guide the plant's aerial roots or stems towards the command hook
Secure the plant to the command hook as it grows (if necessary)
Monitor the plant's progress and trim any unsightly growth

tasks.task: Create a green wall trellis in an urban setting
subtasks: Plan the layout and design of the green wall
Install multiple command hooks at various points on the wall
Select a variety of攀爬植物 (not directly translatable, but may refer to vines, such as pothos, philodendron, etc.) for the wall
Train the plants to grow towards and attach to the command hooks
Prune and shape the plants to achieve the desired aesthetic
Maintain the green wall by watering, fertilizing, and providing appropriate care

tasks.task: Create a green wall trellis in an apartment or urban area. Under that, subtasks would include planning the layout (so "plan the layout and design of the green wall"), installing multiple command hooks at different points on the wall (so "install multiple command hooks at various points on the wall"), selecting various plants (like different vines) that can climb (so "select a variety of vines for the wall"), training those plants to grow towards and attach to the command hooks, and then pruning and maintaining the wall. So I think that's a separate main task.

tasks.task: But since the video demonstrates the process for a single plant, I think the main task should be about that. The viewer could then expand by following the second set of tasks for a larger installation. So, I think the appropriate tasks are the first set. Therefore, I will finalize the answer with those four main tasks under the MAINTASK "Train plants to climb a wall using command hooks." If a user wants to replicate what's shown in the video, they need to perform these steps. However, if they want to build a more extensive green wall, they can refer to the second MAINTASK.
